The food is excellent, especially the house-made steamed dumplings, the meat pie (trust me), the super-spicy kung pao pork (not for the weakhearted) and the velvet chicken. Jeff and his wife have made me, my wife and our daughter feel like we were members of their extended family from day one and we will keep on returning for more of their good old home cooking.
author: Josh D.

description: Good quality food for a reasonable price. Excellent service! Especially Luis who showed us such hospitality the other night. I really enjoy the food here. The leftovers were even good a few days later. And the food can be more spicy, if you let them know that's what you want! Our food was reeally spicy, and it was exactly what I wanted. I will definitely be a regular customer here.
author: Michelle W.

description:
Best Chinese food in the city and now they deliver! Everything on the menu is delicious,  Henry's Special is my favorite, but I like them all!  

Just a warning that they r on d heavy side, so perfect for hangover, not so perfect if u r looking for something light!
author: Y B.

description: This to me is good, not great. The hot and sour soup is just gross and I love soup. The meat pie is pretty good, same with some of the chow mein dishes.  Good hang over food, I would say.
author: Samantha S.

description:
This most white-people-friendly "Chinese" restaurant you've ever been to that's actually good! We were on the hunt for some pf-changs/panda express style chinese food, but of a greater quality and still at a decent price. We found it at Henry's Hunan. Perfect.

The menu is as you might expect, kung-pao chicken, mongolian beef, egg rolls, wonton soup, etc. etc. But the difference is that there is actually really great execution. The hot & sour soup was excellent. The curry chow mein is like a replica of singapore curry rice noodles, but in chow mein. This worked well too. Lastly, the kung pao chicken was dead on. Chicken was fresh, it was spicy, and there was plenty of actual chicken in it. Even the green tea was standard-average-great!

What I like is just how friendly this place is. All the main entrees are around $9 and sized for sharing. The place itself is bright, with a high ceiling and modern decor. However, the room is small enough so that it still feels intimate despite those conditions. The location is great if you need to find parking (and is right next to a muni rail line as well).

Overall, this is a great deal for white-people-"chinese"-food.
author: Tolga E.

description:
Really great place. Some of the best chinese food I've ever had. Everything was spicy and delicious.

More importantly, the quality of the food was top notch. No mystery meat here. The chicken was breast pieces, the beef looked like actual steak. The veggies were fresh. We tried 7 things and all were great.

The service was very friendly. And it was very cheap. I wish I lived closer to this restaurant.
author: Sachin A.

description: Excellent food. The egg rolls are the best I had. Service is friendly.  Seating was tight and uncomfortable
author: Andy B.

description:
Great joint to go if you are in the vein for spicy food. Also every dish has a different and interesting combinations of spices. Incredible, but not shocking they got the Michelin star.

Staff overall is very attentive and friendly and the owner, well, just really outgoing and in tune with the neighborhood feel.
author: Tommaso T.

description: This is what a dining experience should be. It starts with Jeff welcoming you in and making you feel like part of the family. Never had a bad dish. Highly recomend the Kung Pao Pork and the Ham with string beans. Try the meat pie for a taste of an asian taco.
author: Gregg P.

description:
Absolutely amazing.  GET THE WONTON SOUP!!! Its the best chinese soup I have ever had. The soups are perfect. I can't shut up about how good Henry's Hunan is. Great interior, beautiful dishes, and amazing service.

Go eat it or your stupid.
author: Mitch A.

description: Great food, great service. This is our go-to delivery place when I don't want to cook. YUM!
author: Troinex C.

description: Great food, close to home, excellent service, and reasonable prices!! I think we have found a keeper on Chinese food outside of Chinatown. Nothing bad about this place (maybe a little Con: there tends to be a packed house for dinner on weekends but which great restaurant doesn't have this issue). That's my story and I sticking with it.
author: Violeta E.

description: Hands down the best Chinese Food in SF - and that's saying a lot. Jeff and his wife Mary are fantastic and the service is fast.  The food is superb - my husband loves the Rock Cod (among many others).  I am vegetarian and they will make anything I request, not just what's on the menu, although they have great veggie options. They will make me "Orange Tofu" in the spirit of Orange Chicken - it is delish!  There are many Henry's in the city, but I think the Church location is best. I love, love, love Henry's!
author: Jessica T.

description: As promised, they now deliver - so 5 stars it is.  Friendly delivery peeps and food, as always, is delicious.  OMG, I think I'm addicted to their kung pao!
author: Julie L.

description:
Bad news Bears, kids.

I totally order a boat load of shit:
I'm talking spring rolls (deep fried, not fresh like Vietnamese ones),
won ton soup, beef w/ broccoli and velvet chicken (aka, chicken with
a bunch of vegetables in a savory sauce.)

I ate the spring rolls and soup and was fine.
Then I ate the beef, followed by a bit of the chicken.

I totally lost my shit like an hour later.  It was a major bummer, 
dudes.  It might have been the raging stomach flu I was coming off
of or the shit Cher movie I was watching on television, but jesus
fucking christ on a cracker, it actually hurt coming back up.

Henry - you've failed me.  Never again.
author: kates d.

description:
Jeff & Eddie's is a paragon of budget Chinese food. In your average establishment, you can get cheap food or good food. At Jeff & Eddie's you get both! Specifically, you'll get fresh, flavorful, and reasonably-priced southern Chinese cuisine.

The majority of the dishes are more spicy, less sugary, and perhaps less pandering to American tastes than your typical establishment. Portions are also incredibly generous, so prepare to take home leftovers! Some dishes can be too salty from time to time, but that may depend on your own tastes. For carnivores: try anything with ham in it! Harvest pork is also an excellent dish. A personal favorite is chow mein with ham. 

Service is always great too. Jeff and Eddie are both very friendly, generous, and accommodating people who will always greet you with a smile. Some times they can get a bit busy, but food always shows up in a reasonable amount of time.

Call in advance if you have a group! Some times the restaurant can get crowded. Parking is a real pain in that neighborhood, too, so take the train if you can!
author: Tom S.

description: Truly fantasic Chinese food for the price.  The smoked ham chowmein was simply sublime.  They even do takeout (will I ever go anywhere else for Chinese takeout?) but the location is nice and the staff are friendly.
author: James C.

description: Just had my first meal at Henry's.  Chow mein was great, service was A+, orange chicken, egg roll and fish were okay, not amazing.  Overall, it's a nice place that is really welcoming and kind to children.  I'll be back for sure and I recommend this to people wanting some good, natural tasting chinese food ;)
author: M K.

description:
The food is some of the best Chinese food you can find in the city, if not the best. I love every single dish I've tried, with special emphasis on the Hot and Sour Soup, the Garlic Chicken, and the dumplings. 

More than that, I love Jeff & Eddie. They're the nicest, most accommodating, and dutiful hosts I've seen in a restaurant. They remember everyone who comes in, they treat everyone like they're the most important customer, and things only get better for return customers.
author: Ethan A.

description: This place is really good. These guys are sooo nice and the food isn't at all greasy. They also have lots of vegetarian options. I highly recommned the moo shu tofu! Can't get that usually. The prices are also reasonable and there is plenty of hot tea available. I did think there was some extra 'flavor dimension' that was lacking but I'm probably being picky.
author: Kristin S.

description: This is my go to Chinese place. The food is good, the price is low, the delivery is fast, and the service is always really great! The veggie chow mein is my favorite :)
author: Ms. G.

description: I want to really like this place but sometimes when I eat it it goes right through me. The guy who answers the phone delivery is really nice and delivery is really fast. I think that the food is a little too oily or something as I don't feel great after (even though it tastes pretty good).
author: Ben L.

description: Excellent and tasty. The place was packed and super busy, but everyone was friendly and accommodating. A+ for the kung pow chicken, and delicious noodles.
author: Jason P.

description:
Love this place, the food is always fantastic...although we're not super creative when it comes to ordering - we stick to the basics like pork fried rice, hot sour soup, etc...and it's by far the friendliest delivery ever - even when it's pouring out.  

Only thing missing is that they don't have Chow Fun...we miss the chow fun from Tai Chi, but too far to drive since moving over to Noe.
author: J B.

description: Went to Henry's based on a recommendation from a friend.  The decor is nice-clean and modern with nice touches.  The staff, (Eddie) is very friendly and helpful.  Service was excellent as was the food.  I will most definitely return.  I'm a big fan of Eric's chinese down the street, but over the years have just grown a little bored - Henry's is a very nice change.  Give them a try ....you won't be disappointed!
author: Kevin G.

description: I'm vegetarian and this is my favourite Chinese restaurant in the city. I love their tofu dishes - kung pao tofu is pretty amazing. I would also recommend the soup (hot and sour) and the moo shu. Henry's in the best!
author: Rushabh D.

description:
Fantastic! Hot (if you want)! Yummy all the way!

This is my new favorite place in the neighborhood. Yeah, Eric's is good... but it's too nouveau feeling.  And Alice's is good too... but not as good as Eric's.  When you want something different... (and in my opinion, much better) Henry's Hunan is it. 

Let me try that again... when you want something CLASSIC (not new-age California-esq Chinese, like Eric's or Alice's), and you want taste to come ahead of everything else... go to Henry's.

Did I mention that it's super yummy? it's the judicious use of ingredients that makes it so great.  All the regular items, and some new ones are there too.

The place is owned by Jeff and Eddie (who are grandsons of Henry himself, I believe.)  They are both super nice and love to chat.

If you're not sure what to order, here's a great resource: http://greasepig.com/henrys/

Yum.
author: Saul F.

description: Hands down the BEST Chinese food I've eaten. Very fresh high quality ingredients. I can't wait to return. I do have to agree with other reviewers that the service is a bit slow. We had to remind the waiter for our drinks and soup or they probably would have arrived at the same time as the meal.
author: Dj S.

description: Eric's used to be our go-to local chinese restaurant - my kids like the potstickers there - but I was tiring as it seemed everything there was beginning to taste the same. So excited to try Henry's when it opened and it is now officially my number one local chinese restaurant and I am a big fan. A nice selection of vegetarian and fish food (and my family says the meat dishes are good too), a mix of interesting flavors, and they are even able to make vegetarian chow mein (not usually the most exciting of dishes) quite delicious with the noodles taking on a lovely toasty taste in the stir frying. Oh, and they are soooo friendly and really, really nice to our kids too. Love it.
author: susannah b.

description: I love henrys special! Spicy seafood stir fry! Delicious:)
author: Angela C.

description: Move over Alice, Eric take a seat and learn because Henry's Hunan is legit..  The food is absolutely amazing, its fresh, comes sizzling to your table.  I've been there on multiple occasions and have always been pleased with everything, its our new favorite Chinese Food place.  I live in Noe, I know the competition.  Henry your a winner!!!
author: Tony A.

description:
wow!!! the food is incredible.  the service is incredible.   I have a table I prefer so I often get my table.  Eddie knows us because we go in frequently and always stops by our table.  Everyone in there is attentive and kind.  I love that my water glass is always full.  You never feel rushed. I always leave completely satisfied.  For lunch try the shrimp in black sauce--YUMMY!!!!!  For an appetizer--the dumplings melt in your mouth.  For dinner--I love it all.
We always ask for everything extremely mild and no peppers and it comes just like that--woo hoo!!!!!!
Go for a visit--stay awhile--you'll love it.
author: Jaymi Marie P.

description:
Ordered wonton soup, curry veggies and tofu, and a non-spicy beef dish to go.  The 2 main dishes were so oily, the boxes were completely saturated and dripping by the time we got home.  The only taste in the curry dish was hot pepper--it looked yellow from maybe a hint of tumeric, but no curry flavors were evident.  The wonton soup wasn't as great as I remembered, but perhaps my expectations were too high considering the fail of the other dishes.

The portions were very generous--one dish will definitely feed 2-3 people, but we tossed the inedible leftovers.

In any case, it kept both of us up all night and I threw away the flier.
author: Lucca C.

description: have been coming here for about 2-3 years now and every week I always order the mongolian beef over rice or with pan fried noodles. The curry fish is always very good and the curry shrimp chow mien.
author: Jennifer N.

description: I am so glad to finally have a good Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood! My boyfriend and I have been here a few times and the food has always been excellent. I especially recommend the chicken chow mein (hold the bean sprouts!) and appreciate how gracious the staff are whenever I spill my soup or my water.  (For some reason, I am always spilling things there. I'm young, so it's endearing, but when I'm 95 years old, it will be a troubling sign of motor function decline.)
author: Jessica L.

description: Really good Hunan American Chinese although I still think I prefer House of Nan King.  The experience was limited by the fact that I only had two other people to share dishes with, and one of them was my sister, the vegetarian.  The dumplings (steamed pork - no other option) were large and delicious, the hot and sour seemed homemade and was good but a little too much on the sour side, the ma pa tofu was ok but I don't think this would be one of their stronger dishes, and the spicy braised rock cods were tasty, although everyone was disappointed when they came out breaded.
author: Paul K.

description: I just found out they deliver and my world has improved 10 fold!  I Love Henry's!
author: Cork C.

description: this place rocks.. Must try for Hunan food lovers.. they have great hot and sour soup also love their garlic chicken and Chow mein..its the perfect combo.. the portions are also great. So if you are thinking of trying some good decently priced Hunan food.. give this place a try..!
author: Shweta P.

description: This was a small restaurant in my sister's neighborhood that she recommended and I was glad she did.  The host was very friendly and promptly sat us at a small booth.  The food was solid and my mom and I enjoyed the beef and broccoli and garlic chicken so much we ate it all!  Top it off with a pot of jasmine tea and our stomachs were happy.  We will definitely be back.
author: Christine P.

description: I worked 1 block from henry's Bryant st locale for 7 years. Lets just say I got intimate with the menu. Noe Valley (this reviewer included) is in for a local sensation.  Its early - very early in their new space - but Jeff and his staff know how to deliver quality food, always fast and courteous. Chicken salad is a staple, and Diana's meat pie tastes as good as the name sound bad. The scales of chinese cuisine tip ever southward to "Nowhere Valley". Competition will keep Eric's and Alice's on their toes.
author: brian s.

description:
We ordered a few of the spicy dishes, and one was a tofu dish. (I've forgotten the actual names as we went a few weeks ago). 
It was really really salty, more salty than hot, and I thought that was a little strange. I actually had the manager on staff (maybe that was Henry?) come by and taste the tofu himself to ask if it was meant to be this salty. He tried it, and then agreed that the tofu had marinated for too long.  
I really appreciated his honesty and he gave us a discount. However, the other dish we had was really salty too and I wasn't about to have him taste that one too!  nice service though.  Next time I am ordering something else.
author: Alison W.

description: Great delivery service-- worst Chinese food I've had in a long time. It was sooo salty, my girlfriend thought her kidneys might shut down...the leftovers are in the trash and we're going to have to go out to get another dinner. Gross!
author: Heather M.

description:
so i decided to give this place another try after not having a good experience the time before.  i ordered the mongolian beef, curry chow mein, and some kind of chicken. 

the food tasted good at first, but a little more than half way through my meal everything began to taste very salty.  i think they use a lot of MSG.  i couldn't finish my food because it was drying out my throat.

i would have to save the service is good.  the lady there offered us rice free of charge since our noodles would take a long time.  is it weird to expect tea at an asian restaurant?  i feel offended when they don't automatically serve tea to me or ask if i want it, when i see other tables with tea on it.

i'd rate this restaurant a 2.5
author: Cedric F.

description:
My parents have gone to Henry's hunan (Sansome, Bryant and Natoma locations) for the last 26 years since they've been in San Francisco and as a child I grew up eating only Henry's Hunan chinese food. It is amazing and always will be.
The staff/owners/everyone who puts their hard work into this restaurant is great and extremely friendly. We come to Hunan close to 7-10 times per year and it's always a great experience. 
Onion cakes are great but Diana's Meat Pie is delightful. We usually have the "usual" of hot and sour chicken, kung pao chicken, curry chicken, etc. but recently I've been playing around with a few other dishes both new and old. The curried chowmein is just as good as the regular chowmein. The potato strips are great- love the texture and the unique flavor. I've also had their five bean curd dish which took me by surprise, I liked it alot. 
Definitely go try Hunan if you haven't already.
author: Sia P.

description:
Not only is the food great, the owners are wonderful.  They always remember my name, my order, my child's name and I've seen them do the same with other friends.  

My favorites include:

Country Style Vegetables
Shrimp with Broccoli

and above all, their dumplings!

They are an amazing addition to the Noe neighborhood.

PARENTS: They are fantastic with little ones and serve them a special plate of veggies and non-spicy tofu.
author: Barbara S.

description: Do yourself a favor.  Take your $25,  go to the grocery store and buy something to eat.  It will be 100% better for you and you'll get your moneys worth.  My experience does not reflect all of the positive reviews below. My food was extremely greasy, not much flavor.  Very salty.  Not fresh.  Rubbery, chewy fish, greasy breaded chicken.. Nothing fresh and nothing good.  Truth.
author: Robert P.

description: I live down the street from this place, and never went in because of the Henry's Hunan in SOMA.  BUT!  I went the other day and was so surprised!  The decor is very modern and cool, and the food is excellent.  I really like the servers too.  I'm guessing Jeff and Eddie are different owners, it is nothing like soma.
author: Amanda T.

description: Henry's never fails to help out a girl in hunger. dinner was amazing- green beans, onion pie with hot chili sauce. Conversation was so hyponotizing that I did not realize that I scooped way too much chili paste into my wor wong ton soup. I bit into my tougue not to scream out " Hoooooot!"  The fantasical wait staff kept a safe "distant yet close enough-ness" to get all the needs of a 2 party meal. :))
author: linda l.

description: Excellent Chinese cuisine. Good variety. Love the spicey items, especially the really fresh shrimp and tofu.
author: Joey D.

description: I used to work a few blocks away from Hentry's Natoma branch and ordered take out/delivery all the time whenever I was working late.  I was sad to move away from Henry's, but SUPER happy they opened the Noe Valley branch close to home!  This is one of my go-to chinese restaurants.  I like how they have brown rice and they never hesitate to give me spice when I ask for spicy!  Henry's special (with scallops, shrimp and chicken with veggies - super spicy sauce) is my all time favorite dish.  I order it all the time.  When my husband and I ate her the other day, he ordered kung pao beef, which he thought was yummy too.  He also reminded me to make sure that diners know the tea cups tend to tip over rather easily (such is his only critique).  But anyways, I'll be putting the Noe Valley number on speed dial for evening pickups.  Go Henry's!
author: Leah S.

description: More traditional than Erics and Alices, but very fresh and tasty, and check-out their meat pie! Nice add to the neighborhood.
author: Peter H.

description: This is a great place to grab something quick...it's a higher end panda express...and I love PE
author: Tim H.

description: My toddler son and I ordered for an early dinner delivery.  Henry's is solid, family friendly Chinese delivery. We had dumplings, chicken and broccoli, mu-shu vegetables, and dry-fried string beans.  My son loved it, not too spicy, plenty of sugary oil.  This is neighborhood, Chinese comfort food.  Solid, fast, and affordable.
author: Mary H.

description: Salty, savory goodness. I don't think it's "authentic" Chinese food, but it is spicy -- and tasty. Tonight, which was the second time we'd ordered from Henry's, I particularly enjoyed the meat pie. Odd, yet delicious, thin, fried bread sandwiching ground meat and some cabbage. String beans: nothing unusual. Chicken, also conventionally appealing. The house tofu, on the other hand, is like nothing I've had elsewhere, big chunks of tofu in a salty sauce. Brown rice to round it out. A good take-out option.
author: Tara M.

description:
My first impression of this restaurant is that it looks kind of cute. The service was good, and obviously it's a family business. After tasting the food, you would know for sure it's Chinese Food made for White people. The noodles I ordered was VERY salty. 

But it seems like it's a very popular place to have dinner in this neighbor.
author: Nick S.

description: Amazing Hunan food.  The ma po tofu is as good as my mother used to make.  Maybe better!  (Sorry, mom.)  The cooking is authentic, the food is fresh, and Jeff, Eddie and Mary are kind, caring and attentive.  They used to run the Henry's on Brannan -- but it's worth making the trek to Church St. for their service and excellent food.  This place is fantastic!
author: Joe K.

description:
Found this new location by accident (only been opened for 5 weeks, that's what Eddie said). Was helping my brother to look for a new home and we had to kill time since open house didn't start until 2pm. We were hungry and this just happened to be in the same location as the house he was interested in. Got out of the car and only saw the Hunan and didn't put it together until I opened the menu and saw Diane's meat pie. And let me say, I was excited. I haven't been to Henry's for months now and of course Henry did not disappoint me. We ordered Diane's meat pie (as you can guess) and the dumplings. Both were tasty and mmmm mm mmmm. The we ordered orange chicken and sweat n sour chicken. Of course they were mmmm mm mmmm as well. 
The food was excellent, the place was new, price was moderate, and Eddie who was our server as well as the co-owner was fabulous and welcoming. If some luck my brother purchase that home, I'll be there often and know that great Chinese food is just a block away. The only set back is that they don't do delivery because their kitchen isn't big enough to handle the volume of orders (once again that came from Eddie)
author: Kathy T.

description: I hate to break the 5 star pattern, but I just can't give this place 5 stars. The waiters were all very friendly, as others have said.  I thought the food was good, but not just not amazing...and I really wanted this place to be amazing. Definitely try it though.
author: Emily A.

description: These guys are so friendly and the food is delicious.   You can't go wrong with the Harvest Pork, String Beans with Chicken, or Shrimp with Tofu and meat sauce.
author: workingstiff f.

description:
We visited this restaurant a week after it opened.  We really wanted to like this place as it's new and close to home.  

But the food just wasn't superb.  The pot stickers tasted metallic, and a chicken dish simply didn't have any taste.  Also, they didn't quite have the kinks worked out on the dishwashing machine, as all of the glasses smelled like bleach.

The wait staff was extremely friendly, so that was a major plus.

I think this was simply was opening week kinks that needed to be worked out.  We'll definitely go back, and I hope things have improved
author: J D.

description: always a fan of Eric's but this place did a respectable job too, not too greazy , fried rice is unbelievable . hunan velvet chicken is full  of flavors and spices,definetly an upscale chinese place
author: NAEL K.

description:
this place is good, i'm not sure where all these 5 stars are coming from.  standard hunan fare, although i enjoyed this location more than a couple others i've been too around town over the years.  
i still have a tear in my eye that the old J&E's Pescheria is gone from this spot, as i sat there and ate it just wasn't as cute in there as it used to be.
in all honesty i'll probably still continue to frequent eric's more than here.
author: e w.

description: The shredded pork with celery is spicy, clean, delicious. The dumplings are addictive. The brown rice was a bit mushy. The chicken salad was inedible. Despite its fresh-sounding description, the "specially prepared sauce" is a peanut-buttery gloppy mess. Overall I recommend Henry's as a tasty Chinese delivery with super friendly service, but the dishes are hit or miss. I'll probably find the ones I like and stick with them.
author: Erika F.

description:
Update 8-23-10:

I keep going back, although I have to cross the bridge to do so. It's the only Henry's location that is "nice", it has the real Henry's food, heck they are Henry's kids! (all grown up after what, 30 years?).

You get extras here, too - a little salad or soup, a spring roll or potsticker. 

And believe it or not, you can choose "original style" meat over the rice (on the rice plate lunches) or "new style" rice on the side. Gravy on, or gravy off? Now up to you!

_________________________ original review:

Just like the original Henry's in Chinatown. But a lot cleaner, a great place to take your sweetie. "Hole in the wall" quality Chinese food in a nice trendy looking restaurant, using top quality ingredients. Very friendly crew, with some old faces I remember from the '90's at their Sacramento location. Owned by a Henry relative.

Oh - I got hit with an extra salty dish last time. Next time I'll ask them to watch the salt! Most of the time its fine....
author: MDubb W.

description: Henry's Hunan has the best Chinese food! Their kung pao tofu is the best ever :)  It is a family run business & everyone is really nice. I also love their hot & sour soup & onion cake. They also are very reasonable in the $ department -- I have had many wonderful lunches there for $12.
author: Owl B.

description: Our go-to for Chinese take-out. Fresh ingredients. They are happy to make alterations, like substituting beef/chicken with tofu. They also make things nice and spicy if you ask. Friendly staff, too.
author: Lee S.

description: Love this place, order take out at least once a week.  Say hi to Eddie and Jeff, super nice guys.  I always have the meat pie, don't forget to ask for the black bean hot sauce to go with it.
author: Tammy W.

description: My previous glowing review is all true, and now they deliver, even thru a rare San Francisco hail storm!!!  We LOVE Henry's!
author: Rosie N.

description: One of my favorite places!  cheap, bit greasy, satisfies the cravings!  who doesn't love to eat out of a to go box.  =)
author: Jen B.

description: I am very happy that this restaurant has come to Noe Valley. Their food is simple and homey, but actually tastes pretty good. The service is a bit slow, but the staff is friendly. I like Henry's much better than the hyped Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood.
author: Charlie S.

description: I love this restaurant.  It is our cheap eat...always consistent.  Healthy food,  they don't use a lot of oil, no MSG, and Jeff and Eddie ( i am presuming the owners) are always always always there to greet me with a smile - even when I'm walking by.  I love the chicken broccoli w/ brown rice!
author: Miles i.

description: I been going to Henry's over on Bryant St. for years and now the newest location on Church. Jeff and Eddie are great, and the food is just as good. Spicy if you choose but with a wholesome taste, and all natural ingredients as it says on the menu...and no MSG. My personal favorite is Green Beans and chicken over rice, and i love the hot and sour tofu soup.....and on a rare warm weather day in San Franciscso, the Cold chicken salad with noodles, is very very tasty and filling.  I also like the Kung Pao chicken or shrimp over rice.....spicy of course! And the meat pie on occasion is awesome.
author: Norman C.

description: went to this restaurant today.  with eric's nearby, i made an error.  the veggie egg rolls were greasy and obviously frozen, then fried.  the won ton soup had no flavor and the won ton's were not cooked.  when i told the waitress that i didn't like the soup, she didn't say a word, just walked away and brought the check.  i expected more from noe valley and this restaurant.  don't waste the time here, when there are so many great options in san francisco.
author: Nancy M.

description: The BEST dumplings in the Universe.  Seriously.  The beef with bean curd is also so amazingly tasty.  All the Henry Hunan's in SF have pretty much the same menu and same delicious dishes, but this location has Jeff, the super friendly manager and waiter, too!
author: Rachel P.

description: Fantastic, friendly service and great, casual, fast and tasty food.
author: Nena G.

description: I didn't think that I could get better Hot & Sour soup than at the Bryant St Henry's, but Jeff & Eddie's has surpassed that! We ate at the location in Noe Valley on their opening night (which was lucky for us, as it was totally packed - amazing since I heard that they didn't advertise, and it was all 'word of mouth' clientele) and thoroughly enjoyed the classy decor and the great food. We'll be back (SOON!)
author: Tara M.

description: I like this Noe Valley version of Henry's Hunan.  It is very clean, and almost hip(!).  The menu items are always very good, and the owners/managers are super friendly and have customer service as their top priority.
author: Jon S.

description: One night when we were hungry and searching for dinner we happened upon Henry's.  It was great!  The people welcomed us and served us wonderful, flavorful, healthy food.  We loved it and can't wait to go back.
author: Bea Z.

description: I agree with Heather M. Worst Chinese food I've had in a while, and I eat quick a bit of cheap Chinese.  Vegies were too salty and oily to eat.  Everything was spicy with no flavor under the spice.  And the chicken was down right gross. I'm going to stick to the cheap Chinese on 24th.
author: N O.

description: We went in with a fairly Hoosier attitude, but the crispy scallion/onion appetizer was a vinegary, delightfully almost-too-greasy sinfully yummy tease. The soup was fresh, authentic, not too salty (altho some might have been put off by the amount of eggwhite). The cold cucumber & lettuce salad was spot on. We ordered just one more thing, which was an enteee of precooked pork and cabbage and scallion (Harvest Pork I believe it was called).  Clean, fresh, very tasty, and abundant. This is the restaurant you want in your neighborhood as the world slides into a deep and scathing recession -- total bill for two people walking out very satisfied with a Tsingtao under the belt and a proprietor shaking our hand was $37. .. I never understood the mediocrity and lifeless food at Erics, this is the answer. PS, I've been to PF Changs and its just overpriced decorated yuppyfood.  This is comfort food, a different harmonic that requires empathy to tune into.
author: Mark P.

description: I've been going to all the other Henry's for awhile. Church street definitely is going to be a hard competitor for Alice's and Eric's. Has some great dishes for kids--dumplings, spring roles, or onion pancake. If you haven't been to Henry's Hunan yet, going soon would be a good idea!
author: Katie C.

description: First time diner at this location, I usually go to the one on Sansome as that was where friends brought me years ago.  Just found this location while searching for reasonably priced food for a gathering of friends and family after a performance.  Was pleasantly surprised at the consistant taste from the other location and my guests are new fans.  They commented several times, "Why haven't you brought us here before?"  I love that the food suits many tastes. from hot and spicy, my favorite, to mild yet still flavorful.  My mother doesn't like spicy, my sister must have it as hot as she can stand and my best friend's a vegetarian while I just love the tofu and meat sauce with or on anything.  The restaurant is cute, but small, best to make a reservation, well worth a wait in a great area of town and best of all, you can watch them prepare your food if you don't mind sitting at the bar.  I would eat here three times a week if I could.
author: Jolie B.

description: Great service.  Good food.  Owner Eddie is super friendly and helpful.
author: Nile L.

description: It was ok. I ordered from them based on the reviews i read here, and with all due respect, those that say henrys is better than Eric's or Alices clearly don't know what they're talkin about. Henrys doesn't have anything on either of them. Even big lantern is better. Sorry, but I won't be ordering from them again.
author: Customer X.

description: This place has wonderful food. I really enjoy the freshness and spiciness of the dishes. We had the orange chicken tonight - awesome. I like my sauteed green beans a bit on the drier side, and it's sometimes a bit chilly inside the restaurant - it's a difficult to heat place, evidently. But, the proprietors and staff are so wonderful and friendly, they make the place very warm. This was my 3rd time, and I'll definitely be back.
author: Seth B.

description:
these guys are great. very friendly and welcoming.  i've only ever ordered meals to go- but the restaurant always struck me as very comfortable and clean.  the best chinese food in the neighborhood as far as i'm concerned.  

my only reasons for not giving a perfect 5 stars might not be detractors for others- parking in the neighborhood can be a drag (but the j-church stops right in front for easy public transit access), and whenever i order a full meal for 2 (with appetizers, soup and entrees and rice) it's always a bit more costly than i'd hope (though still more reasonable than many alternatives).
author: Jay J.

description: Dumplings, and pork and cabbage noodle are some of the best dishes around.  Items can be spicy but that is Hunan style.  Owners are very friendly and accomodating.
author: Bentley L.

description: I always fell back on Eric's when I had a craving for Chinese food. But no more! Henry's is just so tasty without being super greasy. I don't get the salty thing- maybe it was just a temporary thing with the chef. I love the spicy string beans and most of all as a New Yorker I miss Lo Mein. Their chow mein is just like it. aaahhhhh
author: Jung K.

description: Let me re-iterate what has been said... this food is extremely SALTY... almost to the point of being inedible. Despite this, the meat pie is very good, almost like a strange Taco Bell-Chinese type creation.  My advice, get a couple of meat pies to go and make sure you pick up a lot of beer/water to wash it down.
author: Chuck S.

description: Great service, nice sized portions for a reasonable price. but the food was waaaaaaaay too salty.  I eat a lot of Chinese food in lots of different restaurants, and this was the saltiest ever.
author: mickey t.

description: I love me some Henry's Hunan.  Really, does it get any better than a meat pie and a Tsingtao?  Yummy greasy goodness.  No MSG too - you can read all about their rules in the back of the menu.  We went two nights ago and had Meat Pie, Hot & Sour soup, and a Henry's special.  All of it was delicious, and I can't wait to go back!
author: mis c.

description: went on opening day.  service was very friendly and nice.  food was very good and things ran much smoother than expected  for an opening.
author: n. h.
